text: I felt a jealous horn against crows because they give men a harbinger, foretelling the future, and for this reason they take them as witnesses. He wanted the cornea to have the same qualities. Seeing passing travelers, he landed on a tree, shouting at them in a terrible way. When the travelers heard the noise, they went back in fear, except for one of them, who said to the others, "Hey, friends, be quiet; this is just a bird. Their screams are not harbingers. When you vanityfully want to compete with the best, you make a fool of yourself.
title: La corneja y el cuervo
author: nan Esopo
